intro: Picridium intermedium var. janii, commonly known as the Janii's picridium, is a lesser-known variant of the picridium genus within the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and trifoliate leaves, typical of many legumes. The plant is native to specific regions in the Mediterranean, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
